page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: There are still quite a lot of back-to-back houses in Harehills. They were built during the nineteenth century and Leeds has more than most other cities in Britain. The Council are trying to get rid of these houses because they are not up to modern standards. It is not possible to provide as much ventilation in such houses as it is in through terrace houses. Fire dangers are greater in these houses too. In an ordinary house there are at least two doors from which to escape, but a back-to-back house has only one door. If the fire is blazing between the occupants and the door there is little hope of rescue or escape unless a window can be reached.
